column11:
This table provides the Fall 2019 summary of Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It shows the balance of undergraduate and graduate teaching activity, includes “extra credit” adjustments for graduate courses, and then converts total credit hours into standardized FTE enrollments.

By School (Fall 2019):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences: Largest contributor with 56,107 total credit hours, equivalent to about 3,595 FTE students.

Business: Produced 16,699 credit hours for 1,010 FTEs.

Education & Professional Studies: Heavy graduate influence, reaching 17,015 credit hours and 703 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology: Significant teaching load of 40,345 credit hours, supporting 2,501 FTEs.

No School: A very small category with 345 credit hours, about 22 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – teaching volume by level.

Graduate Extra Credit – additional weighting for graduate instruction.

Grand Total Credit Hours – combined total after adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – full-time equivalent enrollments (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).

?? In summary, Fall 2019 saw Liberal Arts & Social Sciences as the largest school by both SCH and FTE, while Engineering, Science & Technology also carried a substantial share of the instructional load.
